caption.title: Variables selected as potential predictors for each question or statement of the survey.

tr.td: How confident are you that the average temperature on Earth is increasing?
Is the Earth getting warmer mostly because of human activity such as burning fossil fuels or mostly because of natural patterns in the Earth’s environment?

td.italic: Indicate your degree of agreement for the following

tr.td: I have a good knowledge of climate change.
Climate change impacts are happening slowly enough to let us adapt as it comes.
Climate change is now noticeable in my region.
The impact of climate change on me and my community is tangible.
The projected impacts of climate change are exaggerated.
What do you think is the probability that the following climatic events will happen more frequently in the next 30 years?
Shifts in timing of the spring period in which freeze-thaw events happen
High number of winter thaw events
Extreme high temperature periods during the spring season that prematurely stop or slow sap flow

td.bold: Climate change impact on maple syrup production

tr.td: In the last decades, which of these climatic hazards have caused significant damage to your sugar bush?
In the last decades, what have been the impact of climate change on tap yield?
Indicate your level of agreement with the following statements concerning current impacts of climate change:
Maple syrup production is closely linked to climate.
The beginning of the tapping season is already happening earlier because of climate change.
Climate change has led to variability in the beginning of the tap season between years.
It is now easy to determine the best moment to tap maples.
In my sugar bush, I have observed an increase in maple dieback because of climate change.
In the next 30 years, what impact will have climate change on tap yield?
Indicate your level of agreement with the following statements concerning future impacts of climate change:
In the next 30 years, the beginning of the sap collection season is going to happen earlier because of climate change.
In the next 30 years, climate change will lead to variability in the beginning of the sap collection season between years.
In the future it will be harder and harder to determine the best moment to tap maples.
Indicate your level of agreement with the following statements:
The existing information on climate change impacts on maple syrup production is easily accessible.
Possible adaptations to climate change are numerous for the maple syrup industry.
New ways to adapt to climate change are needed in the maple syrup industry.
I have a wide knowledge of the newest tapping technologies (e.g., high-vacuum tubing, new spouts, liming and fertilizing, reverse osmosis, silvicultural management, tube cleaning/spout replacement).
New maple syrup technologies will help me face the new challenges coming from climate change.
It is highly probable that I will adopt climate adaptation strategies if I think it could increase my maple syrup production.
Before making any changes to adapt to climate change, I will wait to see what effects it has on my maple syrup production.
Which of these adaptation measures would allow producers in general to effectively adapt to climate change?
Increasing the sugar bush’s number of taps.
Installing a high-vacuum tubing system for sap collection.
Using spring forecast models of sap flow to predict the perfect moment to tap.
Using maples adapted to future climate conditions.
Doing silvicultural management in your sugar bush to, for example, maintain the density of trees at a good level or to favor biodiversity.
Liming and fertilizing to limit maples dieback.
Adopting strong sanitation practices (tubing and spout cleaning and/or annual spout replacement).
Keeping track of new research about maple production.
Which of these adaptation measures would you like to use yourself?
Increasing the sugar bush’s number of taps.
Installing a high-vacuum tubing system for sap collection.
Using spring forecast models of sap flow to predict the perfect moment to tap.
Using maples adapted to future climate conditions.
Doing silvicultural management in your sugar bush to, for example, maintain the density of trees at a good level or to favor biodiversity.
Liming and fertilizing to limit maples dieback.
Adopting strong sanitation practices (tubing and spout cleaning and/or annual spout replacement).
Keeping track of new research about maple production.
Which of these adaptation measures would you like to see used by the maple syrup industry?
Promoting the distinctive syrup harvested in the very late season.
Helping the northward progression of sugar maple by plantation and by human augmented seed transport.
Tapping in the north of the sugar maple distribution range.
Selecting maples that are adapted to future climatic conditions.
To understand how easily your business would be able to adapt (if needed) to any potential impacts of climate change in the future, please indicate if you agree or disagree with each statement below.
If any changes in labor (number of workers, and/or hours worked) are needed due to climate change, my business could quickly get the help it needs to operate.
If any changes in maple production technologies are needed due to climate change, my business could afford to quickly adopt the new technologies.
If any severe damage to my sugar bush occurred due to climate change, my business could quickly change how it collects and/or obtains sap.
Are the following constraints limiting your adoption of new technologies and strategies designed to reduce the impacts of climate change on your business?
I don’t believe that climate change will have much impact on my syrup production
